parameter.name: MACAddressControlEnabled
parameter.description: Indicates whether or not MAC Address Control is enabled on this {{object|#}}. MAC Address Control limits client devices to those whose hardware addresses match the {{param|AllowedMACAddress}} list.

parameter.name: AllowedMACAddress
parameter.description: Hardware addresses of client devices that are allowed to associate with this {{object|#}} if {{param|MACAddressControlEnabled}} is {{true}}.

A list item of 0 indicates that the corresponding response was not received. Round trip times of less than 1 {{units}} MUST be rounded up to 1. The number of list entries is determined by the {{param|#.RouteHopsNumberOfEntries}} parameter.

object.name: Device.IEEE1905.
object.description: This object represents the management functions for the 1905 capabilities as defined in {{bibref|IEEE1905.1a}}.

parameter.name: Version
parameter.description: 1905 profile version number of the AL as would be sent in a Higher Layer response message as defined in {{bibref|IEEE1905.1a|Table 6-37: 1905 profile version TLV}}.

object.name: Device.IEEE1905.AL.
object.description: This object represents the management functions for the 1905 Abstraction Layer as defined in {{bibref|IEEE1905.1a|Section 4.4 Abstraction Layer}}.

parameter.name: IEEE1905Id
parameter.description: 1905 AL MAC Address.

parameter.name: Status

enumeration.description: NOT RECOMMENDED for use; if used it means {{enum|Enabled}}
NOT RECOMMENDED for use; if used it means {{enum|Disabled}}
NOT RECOMMENDED for use; if used it means {{enum|Error}}
NOT RECOMMENDED for use; if used it means {{enum|Error}}
NOT RECOMMENDED for use; if used it means {{enum|Error}}
NOT RECOMMENDED for use; if used it means {{enum|Error}}

parameter.name: LastChange
parameter.description: This parameter is NOT RECOMMENDED to be used because IEEE1905 is not an interface. The accumulated time in {{units}} since the 1905 Abstraction Layer entered its current operational state.

parameter.name: LowerLayers
parameter.description: This parameter is NOT RECOMMENDED to be used because IEEE1905 is not an interface. {{list}} {{reference}} See {{bibref|TR-181i2|Section 4.2.1}}.

parameter.name: RegistrarFreqBand
parameter.description: {{list}} See {{bibref|IEEE1905.1a|Table 6-25: SupportedFreqBand TLV}}. {{enum}}

parameter.name: InterfaceNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

object.name: Device.IEEE1905.AL.Interface.{i}.
object.description: The 1905 interface table (described in {{bibref|IEEE1905.1a|sub-clause 5 Abstraction Layer Management}}).

parameter.name: InterfaceId
parameter.description: MAC Address of this interface. This is the value of the intfAddress parameter defined in {{bibref|IEEE1905.1a|Table 5-2: intfDescriptor elements}}

parameter.name: Status
LastChange
parameter.description: This parameter is NOT RECOMMENDED to be used because it is not a parameter defined in a 1905 ALME primitive or protocol TLV. The accumulated time in {{units}} since the interface entered its current operational state.

parameter.name: LowerLayers
parameter.description: This parameter is NOT RECOMMENDED to be used because it is not a parameter defined in a 1905 ALME primitive or protocol TLV. {{list}} {{reference|an interface object that is stacked immediately below this interface object}} See {{bibref|TR-181i2|Section 4.2.1}}.

parameter.name: InterfaceStackReference
parameter.description: Path name of an interface object described by this 1905 {{object}}. Referenced interface object MUST have a MACAddress and the InterfaceId MUST be the same as the interface object MACAddress.

parameter.name: MediaType
parameter.description: Media type of this {{object}}. This is derived from the value of the intfType parameter defined in {{bibref|IEEE1905.1a|Tables 5.2: intfDescriptor elements}}. {{enum}}

parameter.name: GenericPhyOUI
parameter.description: OUI of the Generic Phy networking technology of the local interface that would be included in a Generic Phy Device Information Type TLV defined in {{bibref|IEEE1905.1a|Tables 6-29: Generic Phy Device Information type TLV}}.

parameter.name: GenericPhyVariant
parameter.description: Variant Index of the Generic Phy networking technology of the local interface that would be included in a Generic Phy Device Information Type TLV defined in {{bibref|IEEE1905.1a|Tables 6-29: Generic Phy Device Information type TLV}}.

parameter.name: GenericPhyURL
parameter.description: URL to Generic Phy XML Description of the Generic Phy networking technology of the local interface that would be included in a Generic Phy Device Information Type TLV defined in {{bibref|IEEE1905.1a|Table 6-29: Generic Phy device information type TLV}}.

parameter.name: SetIntfPowerStateEnabled
parameter.description: Enables or disables the Abstraction Layer's ability to set the power state for the interface. Boolean can be {{true}} for "enabled" and {{false}} for "disabled".

parameter.name: PowerState
parameter.description: The Power State of this {{object}}. This is derived from the value of the powerState parameter as defined in {{bibref|IEEE1905.1a|Tables 5.3: ALME-SET-INTF-PWR-STATE.request parameters and Table 5.7: ALME-GET-INTF-PWR-STATE.response parameters}}. {{enum}}

parameter.name: VendorPropertiesNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

parameter.name: LinkNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

object.name: Device.IEEE1905.AL.Interface.{i}.VendorProperties.{i}.
object.description: This object defines the vendor specific properties (vendorSpecificInfo field) of this {{object|##.Interface}} as defined in {{bibref|IEEE1905.1a|Table 5-2: intfDescriptor elements}}.

parameter.name: OUI
parameter.description: Organizationally unique identifier of a manufacturer of this {{object|##.Interface}}. Represented as a six hexadecimal-digit value using all upper-case letters and including any leading zeros according to {{bibref|IEEE1905.1a|Table 5-20: VendorSpecificInfo information element}}. {{pattern}}

parameter.name: Information
parameter.description: A hexbinary string used to to provide vendor specific information about this {{object|##.Interface}}. This is the value of the vendorSpecificInfo parameter defined in {{bibref|IEEE1905.1a|Table 5-20: VendorSpecificInfo information element}}.

object.name: Device.IEEE1905.AL.Interface.{i}.Link.{i}.
object.description: This object defines the 1905 neighbors and link properties.

parameter.name: InterfaceId
parameter.description: MAC Address of the interface of the Neighbor for this {{object}}. This value comes from the neighbor’s Topology discovery message as defined in {{bibref|IEEE1905.1a|Table 6-9: MAC address typeTLV}}.

parameter.name: IEEE1905Id
parameter.description: MAC Address of the 1905 AL entity of the Neighbor device on this {{object}}. This value comes from the neighbor’s Topology discovery message as defined in {{bibref|IEEE1905.1a|Table 6-8: AL MAC address type TLV}}.

parameter.name: MediaType
parameter.description: Media type of this {{object}}. This value is derived from the neighbor’s Topology response message 1905 device information type TLV Media Type field as defined in {{bibref|IEEE1905.1a|Table 6-12: Media type}}. {{enum}}

parameter.name: GenericPhyOUI
parameter.description: OUI of the Generic Phy networking technology of the interface of the Neighbor for this {{object|#.Link}}. This value is from a Generic Phy response message field as defined in {{bibref|IEEE1905.1a|Tables 6-29: Generic Phy Device Information type TLV}}.

parameter.name: GenericPhyVariant
parameter.description: Variant Index of the Generic Phy networking technology of the interface of the Neighbor for this {{object|#.Link}}. This value is from a Generic Phy response message variant index field as defined in {{bibref|IEEE1905.1a|Tables 6-29: Generic Phy Device Information type TLV}}.

parameter.name: GenericPhyURL
parameter.description: URL to Generic Phy XML Description of the Generic Phy networking technology of the interface of the Neighbor for this {{object|#.Link}}. This value is from a Generic Phy response message URL to Generic Phy field as defined in {{bibref|IEEE1905.1a|Table 6-29: Generic Phy device information type TLV}}.

object.name: Device.IEEE1905.AL.Interface.{i}.Link.{i}.Metric.
object.description: This object represents the metrics for this {{object|##.Link}} as defined in {{bibref|IEEE1905.1a|Tables 6-18: 1905 transmitter link metrics and Table 6-20: 1905 receiver link metrics}}.

parameter.name: IEEE802dot1Bridge
parameter.description: Indicates whether or not the 1905 link includes one or more IEEE 802.1 bridges. If {{false}}, the 1905 link does not include an IEEE 802.1 bridge. If {{true}}, the 1905 link does include one or more IEEE 802.1 bridges.

parameter.name: PacketErrors
parameter.description: Estimated number of lost {{units}} on the transmit side of the link {{bibref|IEEE1905.1a|Table 6-18: 1905 transmitter link metrics}} during a measurement period.

parameter.name: PacketErrorsReceived
parameter.description: Estimated number of lost {{units}} on the receive side of the link {{bibref|IEEE1905.1a|Table 6-20: 1905 receiver link metrics}} during a measurement period.

parameter.name: TransmittedPackets
parameter.description: Estimated number of {{units}} sent to the Neighbor on this {{object|##.Link}}, in the same measurement period used to estimate {{param|PacketErrors}}.

parameter.name: PacketsReceived
parameter.description: Estimated number of {{units}} received from this Neighbor on this {{object|##.Link}} {{bibref|IEEE1905.1a|Table 6-20: 1905 receiver link metrics}}, in the same measurement period used to estimate {{param|PacketErrors}}.

parameter.name: MACThroughputCapacity
parameter.description: The maximum MAC throughput in {{units}} between this {{object|###.Interface}} and the Neighbor on this {{object|##.Link}} that is estimated at this {{object|###.Interface}}.

parameter.name: LinkAvailability
parameter.description: The estimated average {{units}} of time that the {{object|##.Link}} is available for data transmissions.

parameter.name: PHYRate
parameter.description: The Physical Layer (PHY) rate in {{units}} between this {{object|###.Interface}} and the Neighbor on this {{object|##.Link}} that is estimated at this {{object|###.Interface}}.

parameter.name: RSSI
parameter.description: The estimated Received Signal Strength Indicator (RSSI) ratio in {{units}} between this {{object|###.Interface}} and the Neighbor on this {{object|##.Link}} that is estimated at the receive side of this {{object|###.Interface}}.

object.name: Device.IEEE1905.AL.ForwardingTable.
object.description: This object represents the rules to forward PDUs between interfaces within the 1905 Abstraction Layer.

parameter.name: SetForwardingEnabled
parameter.description: Abstraction Layer ability to set, modify, and remove {{object|ForwardingRule}} entries for interfaces. Boolean can be {{true}} for "enabled" and {{false}} for "disabled".

parameter.name: ForwardingRuleNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

object.name: Device.IEEE1905.AL.ForwardingTable.ForwardingRule.{i}.
object.description: The 1905 fowarding rule for the ALME-SET-FWD-RULE.request and ALME-GET-FWD-RULES.response with classification criteria as defined in {{bibref|IEEE1905.1a|Table 5-9: ClassificationSet elements}}.

parameter.name: InterfaceList
parameter.description: The list of interfaces to which a frame satisfying the following classification criteria should be forwarded (intfAddressList parameter as defined in {{bibref|IEEE1905.1a|Table 5-8: ALME-SET-FWD-RULE.request parameters and Table 5-12: fwdRuleList elements}}). {{list}} Each list item MUST be the path name of an object, which MUST be a row of an {{object|##.Interface}} object. If the referenced item is deleted, the corresponding item MUST be removed from the list. {{noreference}}

parameter.name: MACDestinationAddress
parameter.description: Classification criterion. The destination MAC address.

parameter.name: MACDestinationAddressFlag
parameter.description: If {{false}}, the classification criterion {{param|MACDestinationAddress}} is ignored. If {{true}}, the classification criterion {{param|MACDestinationAddress}} is used.

parameter.name: MACSourceAddress
parameter.description: Classification criterion. The source MAC address.

parameter.name: MACSourceAddressFlag
parameter.description: If {{false}}, the classification criterion {{param|MACSourceAddress}} is ignored. If {{true}}, the classification criterion {{param|MACSourceAddress}} is used.

parameter.name: EtherType
parameter.description: Classification criterion. Ether Type Field in a frame.

parameter.name: EtherTypeFlag
parameter.description: If {{false}}, the classification criterion {{param|EtherType}} is ignored. If {{true}}, the classification {{param|EtherType}} is used.

parameter.name: Vid
parameter.description: Classification criterion. IEEE 802.1Q VLAN ID in a frame.

parameter.name: VidFlag
parameter.description: If {{false}}, the classification criterion {{param|Vid}} is ignored. If {{true}}, the classification {{param|Vid}} is used.

parameter.name: PCP
parameter.description: Classification criterion. IEEE 802.1Q Priority Code Point field.

parameter.name: PCPFlag
parameter.description: If {{false}}, the classification criterion {{param|PCP}} is ignored. If {{true}}, the classification {{param|PCP}} is used.

object.name: Device.IEEE1905.AL.NetworkTopology.
object.description: This object represents the 1905 Network Topology capabilities of this device.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enables or disables the 1905 Network Topology reporting (via TR-069). When {{true}}, the device clears and (re)populates the {{object|IEEE1905Device}} and {{object|ChangeLog}} tables. When {{false}}, the contents of the {{object|IEEE1905Device}} and {{object|ChangeLog}} tables have no meaning.

parameter.name: Status
parameter.description: When {{param|Enable}} is set to {{true}}, this parameter indicates the transient phase of the discovery of the {{object}}. {{enum}}

enumeration.description: Indicates that the device is populating the topology object during the transient phase.
Indicates that the transient phase is over and the device is maintaining and updating the topology object as changes occur.
NOT RECOMMENDED for use; if used, indicates that a necessary configuration value is undefined or invalid.

parameter.name: MaxChangeLogEntries
parameter.description: The maximum number of entries allowed in the {{object|ChangeLog}} table.

parameter.name: LastChange
parameter.description: {{reference}} If the {{object|ChangeLog}} is modified the parameter is modified to reflect the last entry added to the {{object|ChangeLog}}.

parameter.name: IEEE1905DeviceNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

parameter.name: ChangeLogNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

object.name: Device.IEEE1905.AL.NetworkTopology.ChangeLog.{i}.
object.description: This object represents log entries for changes in the 1905 Network Topology. The Change Log is a First In First Out queue where the oldest entries (defined by values of the {{param|TimeStamp}} parameter) are deleted once the log is full.

parameter.name: TimeStamp
parameter.description: Date and Time at which the entry was added to the {{object}} table.

parameter.name: EventType
parameter.description: Type of event for this entry. {{enum}}

enumeration.description: Entry represents a discovery of a Neighbor.
Entry represents the loss of a Neighbor.

parameter.name: ReporterDeviceId
parameter.description: 1905 AL MAC Address of device which reported the change.

parameter.name: ReporterInterfaceId
parameter.description: MAC Address of the interface of the reporting device on which the change has been detected.

parameter.name: NeighborType
parameter.description: Type of Neighbor for this event. {{enum}}

parameter.name: NeighborId
parameter.description: MAC Address of the Neighbor of this event. If the value of the {{param|EventType}} parameter is {{enum|NewNeighbor|EventType}}, then the value of this parameter represents the MAC Address of the new Neighbor that joined the network; if the value of the {{param|EventType}} parameter is {{enum|LostNeighbor|EventType}}, then the value of this parameter represents the MAC Address of the Neighbor that left the network. If value of the {{param|NeighborType}} parameter is {{enum|IEEE1905|NeighborType}}, then the value of this parameter is the 1905 AL MAC Address of the Neighbor.

object.name: Device.IEEE1905.AL.NetworkTopology.IEEE1905Device.{i}.
object.description: This object represents an instance of discovered 1905 Devices in the network (received Topology discovery message as defined in {{bibref|IEEE1905.1a|Clause 6.3.1}}).

parameter.name: IEEE1905Id
parameter.description: 1905 AL MAC Address.

parameter.name: Version
parameter.description: 1905 profile version number in Higher Layer Response message as defined in {{bibref|IEEE1905.1a|Table 6-37: 1905 profile version TLV}}.

parameter.name: RegistrarFreqBand
parameter.description: {{list}} of frequency bands identified as supported for a registrar role in an AP-autoconfiguration response message as defined in {{bibref|IEEE1905.1a|Table 6-25: SupportedFreqBand TLV}} {{enum}}.

parameter.name: FriendlyName
parameter.description: Friendly Name String received in Higher Layer response message as defined in {{bibref|IEEE1905.1a|Table 6-30: Device Identification Type TLV}}.

parameter.name: ManufacturerName
parameter.description: Manufacturer Name String received in Higher Layer response message as defined in {{bibref|IEEE1905.1a|Table 6-30: Device Identification Type TLV}}.

parameter.name: ManufacturerModel
parameter.description: Manufacturer Model String received in Higher Layer response message as defined in {{bibref|IEEE1905.1a|Table 6-30: Device Identification Type TLV}}.

parameter.name: ControlURL
parameter.description: Control URL received in Higher Layer response message as defined in defined in {{bibref|IEEE1905.1a|Table 6-31: Control URL Type TLV}}.

parameter.name: VendorPropertiesNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

parameter.name: IPv4AddressNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

parameter.name: IPv6AddressNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

parameter.name: InterfaceNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

parameter.name: NonIEEE1905NeighborNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

parameter.name: IEEE1905NeighborNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

parameter.name: L2NeighborNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

parameter.name: BridgingTupleNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

object.name: Device.IEEE1905.AL.NetworkTopology.IEEE1905Device.{i}.IPv4Address.{i}.
object.description: This object represents represents all IPv4 addresses reported for a MAC address (AL or interface) in a Higher Layer response message for the IEEE1905Device as defined in {{bibref|IEEE1905.1a|Table 6-32: IPv4 type TLV}}.

parameter.name: MACAddress
parameter.description: MAC Address.

parameter.name: IPv4Address
parameter.description: IPv4 Address.

parameter.name: IPv4AddressType
parameter.description: The IPv4 Address Type of this {{param|IPv4Address}}. {{enum}}

parameter.name: DHCPServer
parameter.description: Either IPv4 address of DHCPv4 server or IPv6 address of DHCPv6 server.

object.name: Device.IEEE1905.AL.NetworkTopology.IEEE1905Device.{i}.IPv6Address.{i}.
object.description: This object represents represents all IPv6 addresses reported for a MAC address (AL or interface) in a Higher Layer response message for the IEEE1905Device as defined in {{bibref|IEEE1905.1a|Table 6-34: IPv6 type TLV}}.

parameter.name: MACAddress
parameter.description: MAC Address.

parameter.name: IPv6Address
parameter.description: IPv6 Address.

parameter.name: IPv6AddressType
parameter.description: The IPv6 Address Type of this {{param|IPv6Address}}. {{enum}}

parameter.name: IPv6AddressOrigin
parameter.description: "::" or the IPv6 address of the origin of this IPv6 address.

object.name: Device.IEEE1905.AL.NetworkTopology.IEEE1905Device.{i}.VendorProperties.{i}.
object.description: This object represents vendor specific information received in a message with a Vendor specific TLV (as defined in in {{bibref|IEEE1905.1a|Table 6-7: Vendor specific TLV}}).

parameter.name: MessageType
parameter.description: The Message type of a message received from this IEEE1905Device that contained a Vendor specific TLV, as defined in {{bibref|IEEE1905.1a|Table 6-4: Message type}}.

parameter.name: OUI
parameter.description: This is the value of the Vendor specific OUI defined in {{bibref|IEEE1905.1a|Table 6-7: Vendor specific TLV}}. {{pattern}}

parameter.name: Information
parameter.description: A hexbinary string used to provide vendor specific information. This is the value of the Vendor specific information parameter defined in {{bibref|IEEE1905.1a|Table 6-7: Vendor specific TLV}}.

object.name: Device.IEEE1905.AL.NetworkTopology.IEEE1905Device.{i}.Interface.{i}.
object.description: This object represents an instance of an interface for the {{object|##.IEEE1905Device}}.

parameter.name: InterfaceId
parameter.description: MAC Address of the interface. This comes from the Topology response message as defined in {{bibref|IEEE1905.1a|Table 6-10: 1905 device information type TLV}}.

parameter.name: MediaType
parameter.description: Media type of this {{object}}. This comes from the Topology response message as defined in {{bibref|IEEE1905.1a|Table 6-10: 1905 device information type TLV}}. {{enum}}

parameter.name: PowerState
parameter.description: The Power State of this {{object}}. "{{enum|Off}}" is used for interfaces identified in a Power Off Interface TLV as defined in {{bibref|IEEE1905.1a|Table 6-38}}. "{{enum|On}}" is used for all other interfaces. "{{enum|Power_Save}}" and "{{enum|Unsupported}}" are not used at this time. Updated as a result of a received Interface Power Change response with “request completed” or “alternate change made” Interface Power Change status as defined in {{bibref|IEEE1905.1a|Table 6-40: Interface Power Change status TLV}}. {{enum}}

parameter.name: GenericPhyOUI
parameter.description: {{param}} of this {{object|#.Interface}}. {{pattern}}

parameter.name: GenericPhyVariant
parameter.description: Variant Index of the Generic Phy networking technology of this {{object|#.Interface}}. This value is from a Generic Phy response message variant index field as defined in {{bibref|IEEE1905.1a|Table 6-29: Generic Phy device information type TLV}}.

parameter.name: GenericPhyURL
parameter.description: URL to Generic Phy XML Description of the Generic Phy networking technology of this {{object|#.Interface}}. This value is from a Generic Phy response message URL to generic phy field as defined in {{bibref|IEEE1905.1a|Table 6-29: Generic Phy device information type TLV}}.

parameter.name: NetworkMembership
parameter.description: MACAddress Field from Media specific information for an 802.11 interface provided in a Topology response message 1905 device information type TLV as defined in {{bibref|IEEE1905.1a|Table 6-13: IEEE 802.11 specific information}}.

parameter.name: Role
parameter.description: Field from Media specific information for an 802.11 interface provided in a Topology response message 1905 device information type TLV as defined in {{bibref|IEEE1905.1a|Table 6-13: IEEE 802.11 specific information}}. {{enum}}

parameter.name: APChannelBand
parameter.description: Hexadecimal digit. Field from Media specific information for an 802.11 interface provided in a Topology response message 1905 device information type TLV as defined in {{bibref|IEEE1905.1a|Table 6-13: IEEE 802.11 specific information}}

parameter.name: FrequencyIndex1
parameter.description: Field from Media specific information for an 802.11 interface provided in a Topology response message 1905 device information type TLV as defined in {{bibref|IEEE1905.1a|Table 6-13: IEEE 802.11 specific information}}

parameter.name: FrequencyIndex2
parameter.description: Field from Media specific information for an 802.11 interface provided in a Topology response message 1905 device information type TLV as defined in {{bibref|IEEE1905.1a|Table 6-13: IEEE 802.11 specific information}}

object.name: Device.IEEE1905.AL.NetworkTopology.IEEE1905Device.{i}.NonIEEE1905Neighbor.{i}.
object.description: This object represents an instance of a Non-IEEE1905 Neighbor for the {{object|##.IEEE1905Device}}. These fields come from a Topology response message as defined in {{bibref|IEEE1905.1a|Table 6-14: Non-1905 neighbor device TLV}}.

parameter.name: LocalInterface
parameter.description: {{reference}}

parameter.name: NeighborInterfaceId
parameter.description: MAC Address of the interface for the {{object}}.

object.name: Device.IEEE1905.AL.NetworkTopology.IEEE1905Device.{i}.L2Neighbor.{i}.
object.description: This object represents an instance of an L2 Neighbor for the {{object|##.IEEE1905Device}}. These fields come from a Topology response message as defined in {{bibref|IEEE1905.1a|Table 6-41: L2 neighbor device TLV}}.

parameter.name: LocalInterface
parameter.description: {{reference}}

parameter.name: NeighborInterfaceId
parameter.description: MAC Address of the {{object}}.

parameter.name: BehindInterfaceIds
parameter.description: {{list}} Behind MAC Addresses of the {{object}}.

object.name: Device.IEEE1905.AL.NetworkTopology.IEEE1905Device.{i}.IEEE1905Neighbor.{i}.
object.description: This object represents an instance of an {{object}} for the {{object|##.IEEE1905Device}}. These values are from the Topology response message as defined in {{bibref|IEEE1905.1a|Table 6-15: 1905 neighbor device TLV}}.

parameter.name: LocalInterface
parameter.description: {{reference}}

parameter.name: NeighborDeviceId
parameter.description: 1905 AL MAC Address of the Neighbor.

parameter.name: MetricNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

object.name: Device.IEEE1905.AL.NetworkTopology.IEEE1905Device.{i}.IEEE1905Neighbor.{i}.Metric.{i}.
object.description: This object represents the metrics included in a Link metric response from the IEEE1905Device where {{param|#.LocalInterface}} is the MAC address of an interface in the receiving 1905 AL as defined in {{bibref|IEEE1905.1a|Table 6-17: 1905 transmitter link metric TLV}}.

parameter.name: NeighborMACAddress
parameter.description: The MAC address of an interface in a neighbor 1905 device as defined in {{bibref|IEEE1905.1a|Table 6-17: 1905 transmitter link metric TLV or Table 6-19: 1905 receiver link metric TLV}}.

parameter.name: IEEE802dot1Bridge
parameter.description: Indicates whether or not the 1905 link includes one or more IEEE 802.1 bridges. If {{false}}, the 1905 link does not include an IEEE 802.1 bridge. If {{true}}, the 1905 link does include one or more IEEE 802.1 bridges.

parameter.name: PacketErrors
parameter.description: Estimated number of lost {{units}} on the transmit side of the link {{bibref|IEEE1905.1a|Table 6-18: 1905 transmitter link metrics}} during a measurement period.

parameter.name: PacketErrorsReceived
parameter.description: Estimated number of lost {{units}} on the receive side of the link {{bibref|IEEE1905.1a|Table 6-20: 1905 receiver link metrics}} during a measurement period.

parameter.name: TransmittedPackets
parameter.description: Estimated number of {{units}} sent to the Neighbor on this link, in the same measurement period used to estimate {{param|PacketErrors}}.

parameter.name: PacketsReceived
parameter.description: Estimated number of {{units}} received from this Neighbor {{bibref|IEEE1905.1a|Table 6-20: 1905 receiver link metrics}} on this link, in the same measurement period used to estimate {{param|PacketErrors}}.

parameter.name: MACThroughputCapacity
parameter.description: The maximum MAC throughput in {{units}} between this Interface and the Neighbor on this link that is estimated at this Interface.

parameter.name: LinkAvailability
parameter.description: The estimated average {{units}} of time that this link is idle.

parameter.name: PHYRate
parameter.description: The Physical Layer (PHY) rate in {{units}} between this Interface and the Neighbor on this link that is estimated at this Interface.

parameter.name: RSSI
parameter.description: The estimated Received Signal Strength Indicator (RSSI) ratio in {{units}} between this Interface and the Neighbor on this link that is estimated at the receive side of this Interface. Note: This parameter is valid only for IEEE 802.11 Neighbors.

object.name: Device.IEEE1905.AL.NetworkTopology.IEEE1905Device.{i}.BridgingTuple.{i}.
object.description: This object represents an instance of an {{object}} for the {{object|##.IEEE1905Device}}. These values come from the 1905 Device’s Topology response message as defined in {{bibref|IEEE1905.1a|Table 6-11: Device bridging capability TLV}}.

parameter.name: InterfaceList
parameter.description: {{list}} {{reference}}

object.name: Device.IEEE1905.AL.Security.
object.description: This object represents the Security configuration for the 1905 device as defined in {{bibref|IEEE1905.1a|Section 9.2 Security Setup Methods}}.

parameter.name: SetupMethod
parameter.description: {{list}} Supported security setup method(s) for the network. {{enum}}

parameter.name: Password
parameter.description: 1905 network passphrase for generating security keys.

object.name: Device.IEEE1905.AL.NetworkingRegistrar.
object.description: This object represents the detected Network Registrars detection function for the IEEE 1905 network. They are determined by received AP-autoconfiguration response messages with Registrar role, with supported band as defined in {{bibref|IEEE1905.1a|Table 6-25: SupportedFreqBand TLV}}

parameter.name: Registrar2dot4
parameter.description: {{list}} 1905 AL MAC addresses as determined by source MAC address in received AP-autoconfiguration response messages with supported frequency band of 802.11 2.4 GHz.

parameter.name: Registrar5
parameter.description: {{list}} 1905 AL MAC addresses as determined by source MAC address in received AP-autoconfiguration response messages with supported frequency band of 802.11 5 GHz.

parameter.name: Registrar60
parameter.description: {{list}} 1905 AL MAC addresses as determined by source MAC address in received AP-autoconfiguration response messages with supported frequency band of 802.11 60 GHz.
